Hi,

Spaceplane plus is now part of vanilla ksp and that's great (I loooove this mod), but for god sake, stop calling those parts mk2, they're not :

MK2 is awesome for plane crafting, and so is spaceplane plus, but spaceplane plus is definitely not mk2.

I propose calling that sp2, or mk2+, or mk2.2

It says MK-2 right on the stock nose section pod.

(Oh never mind, you're talking about SP+ parts...)
Are those B9 MK2 parts? If so, I'd be more likely to call the B9 parts "not MK2". Either way, I'm enjoying the new spaceplane parts.

Spaceplane + is NOT part of stock KSP.

Porkjet's spaceplane + parts were modified for the new Mk2 parts - that is, officially, what the lozenge-shaped parts are called.

Mk1 are the 1.5m aircraft parts (including the 'inline Mk1 cockpit', previously known as Mk2), Mk3 are the 'shuttle' shaped parts that still aren't much use (but are also scheduled for replacement).
I think B9 should either change their shape or their name. This is the new Mk II, deal with it.

They are Mk2, because Mk2 is what SQUAD decides it is when they design the stock parts. The Mk2 specification was changed in the 0.25 update, so "Mk2" now denotes the SP+-style parts, which happen to be symmetrical now. Any discrepancies with old mods that have old-style Mk2 parts merely mean that the mod is out of date.

They changed the SP+ parts, they are a different shape than they are in my .24.2, i believe in .24.2 SP+ parts are uneven surfaces top and bottom, for .25 they made them symmetrical top and bottom.

they should have left both options of mk2 fuselage, the new ones hold different amounts of fuel.
